photos.description: 45lb salmon. Carroll did not catch this but was preparing to cut it up to be kippered in the smokehouse or canned for a customer of the Lodge.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
photos.notes: This was scanned from Jean's book. This is the only copy of this image.

photos.description: Carroll, Bruce, Ken, and Carolyn at the West end of North Peapod Island. Jean was the photographer. We would picnic on the beach while the seagulls screamed and flew overhead as this was a large seagull rookery. Now a Federally protected wildlife site - people are not allowed anymore (a good thing) as stupid people would go during nesting season and take eggs, and chase newly hatched birds off their nests into the swirling tidal waters, soon to be carried away and drown.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
photos.notes: This was scanned from Jean's book. This is the only copy of this image.

photos.description: A trip to pick spring flowers (wild Lilies) on Barnes Island - Clark Island in the background. We would go each spring and pick Lady Slippers and Lilies which grew there untouched by anyone else. We would picnic on the tiny beach at the north end of Barnes Island.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
photos.notes: This was scanned from Jean's book. This is the only copy of this image.

photos.description: 'The Culver three' playing on the beach at Pt. Lawrence.

photos.description: Ken pushing the old wood framed wheel barrow with steel wheel. Bruce out front pulling the wheelbarrow through the deep snow with a rope. Cabin 2 on the right.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
photos.notes: This was scanned from Jean's book. This is the only copy of this image.

photos.description: Photo of Pt. Lawrence Lodge in Winter of 1948, one of the coldest and snowiest winters I can remember as a child. We huddled in the kitchen around the wood stove which was the only heated space. Pipes all froze and some broke. Carroll carried fresh water from Alderbrook Creek. A great adventure for kids - a great hassle for parents I am sure.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
photos.notes: This was scanned from Jean's book. This is the only copy of this image.
